description: I accidentally stumpled upon it. Could not believe when I saw it supports polish railways. I love GTK apps, and this one fits the system really well

I only tested it briefly but I love the simple minimalistic design and the features. This is so cool! It's way faster than to go into the browser. The design is more inuitive and simple imo. I'd like to have a "best prices" overview like in the web as an additional feature. So far it seems to work fine
Many important information is displayed in German.
works perfect on mobile and desktop and is intuitive to use.

This only has rail data for Germany / EU countries, the description should go back to starting that. (as a lot of the rest of the world also has railways, and the description is unintentionally deceptive.
Beautiful application that matches the GNOME design and displays the train rides in the Netherlands as expected. I cannot complain.
Works as expected in Germany. It uses the DB API and thus has the same results as the official DB app presented in a really pretty native way.

This looks like good application, but it's almost entirely just for the EU. There are a couple (seemingly random) US systems such as Des Moines and Austin, but it would be nice to get some of the bigger US ones down:
- NYC
- Chicago
- Boston MBTA
- Philadelphia SEPTA
- Denver RTD
- Salt Lake UTA TRAX
- Portland MAX
- Bay Area Rapid Transit/Caltrain
- Seattle Sound Transit

There are many more, but those come to mind immediately.
Macht was es soll - einfach, schön, schön einfach und auf Linux.

Wenig Klimbim, super einfache Bedienung. Riesiges Danke dafür, denn die Webseite der Bahn ist einfach #oldschool.

Klasse!
Sieht nach dem letzten Update deutlich hübscher aus als vorher. Funktioniert immer noch wie es soll.

Sehr einfach, funktioniert gut, sieht gut aus, informativ, sehr gut.
Danke!
Die App startet nur Teilweise und stürzt darauf hin wieder ab.

This app shows how easily we could achieve a true inter-european booking platform. The app works flawlessly on Wayland.

The app offers a lot more information than other train search engines, even those from the rail operators themselves
Would love to see SBB provider, and maybe support for buying tickets would also be interestning
